title: Problems with Patch 6.3
body:
I've had some problems with my connection in games ever since Patch 6.3 came out. I'd just like to say before anything that I have pretty decent internet (iinet NBN), and only very occasionally does it drop for like a second and I get a massive lag spike, or if someone in my house decides to download something at the same time -_-

First problem I had was during a custom 2v2 with my friends and I. It was in ARAM, and I got a message at the top of my screen saying "You have been disconnected from the server. Please try connecting again" or something like that. I got these a lot early last season, but after a few patches I think RIot fixed it, and didn't get it again until this incident.
However, it wasn't a huge problem, as I reconnected pretty quickly afterwards.

The second incident on the other hand, was something. It was a normal game with 4 other friends (5-man) and I was playing Lucian top (OP, trust me) and I was having a bit of lag near the beginning, but nothing game-changing. Then about 20 minutes in, I get a MASSIVE spike, and I mean massive, sky-rocketing to about 17 000 MS and I got the message saying "Attempting to reconnect". Now it wouldn't stop for the rest of the game. I got around 500 ping average, drop down to 80 for like 2 seconds every once in a while and back up again. Getting the message again and again, attempting to reconnect around 7 times, give or take 2.

Really wanna know from a Rioter or someone, if this is a problem with the Patch, or something personal (doubting that though)

Thanks, tURTL3s

replies.body:
Hey there,

Could you please [download WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/download-winmtr/) and run a traceroute to the following IPs (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes), export your results and post them here.

>103.240.227.5
103.240.227.25

Also as stated below if you're running lolreplay or anything similar, please disable this while playing as it has been known to cause issues with the game, perhaps not lag related issues but definitely crashes.

I'm pretty sure it's something to do with Mac, since my brothers aren't having problems (both on windows). It takes so long just to get into the Client, with the message of Retrieving from Server for like a minute, and again going into a custom game to check my ping, instantly went 500, attempting to reconnect twice. Even turned down graphics and everything, but no difference.

Please Help D:

Sorry, I didn't realise you were on Mac OS, must've missed it in your OP.

To run an MTR on mac, please perform the following steps.

* Go [here](http://rudix.org/packages/mtr.html) and download the package appropriate for your version of OSX
* Install it
* [Open terminal](http://i.imgur.com/10nFokA.png)
* Run the following command and hit enter (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes)

>sudo /usr/local/sbin/mtr 103.240.227.5

* After a reasonable amount of time has elapsed (5-15 minutes) please screenshot your results (follow steps below)
 * Hit cmd+shft+4, then hit space
 *  click on the Terminal window (your mouse cursor should turn into a camera icon and the window should be highlighted on mouse over)
* Upload the screenshot anywhere you would like and link here (imgur, etc)

http://imgur.com/GriebA2 This is after about 7 minutes, give or take 1
Sorry for the delayed response. Only checked this morning
Thanks for your help though, appreciate it :)

There doesn't seem to be any noticeable (Excessive) packet loss in that test.

Are you connecting via wi-fi? Could you try a wired connection and let me know if league continues to drop.
Yeah, I'm on a Mac (toaster) so I don't have those replay software

have you checked if these spikes are restricted to league or if they occur during other things as well? for instance if you also play csgo or something, and lag there as well, its probably your ISP or something similar

Or it could be Mac :)
also I have CSGO and it lags occasionally, but well before 6.3 came out.
just uninstall lol replay worked for me :D
